boardgame.name: Famiglia
ファミリア
boardgame.description: Prepare yourself for a fierce duel. Cleverly use the features of the four different families to snatch the most valuable gangsters away from your opponent. Your goal? To have the best gang at the end of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Famiglia, the players collect gangsters with the goal of collecting the highest-valued gangsters. With the exception of the 0-value gangsters, a player normally needs two identical gangsters (same family and same value) to be able to take a gangster with the next highest value of the same family. When a player does this, they place one of the smaller gangsters from their hand into their play area. To get higher-valued gangsters faster, the player may use the special abilities of the different families at the cost of placing more gangsters in their play area. By doing so, a player may reduce their options and so must carefully plan these actions in order to end the game with the most influential gang._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Rio Grande Games (RIO 431) Type: Card Games Number of players: 2 Age of players: 10+ Length: 30 minutes Game Description: The players control two rival gangs and try to recruit additional gang members from the four families (La Famiglia, The Accountants, The Brutes, The Mercenaries) on the Street. The player, who uses the special abilities of the different families better than his opponent, will get the most influential gang and win the game. The players collect gangsters, with the goal of collecting the higher-valued gangsters. With the exception of the smallest gangsters (the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;0_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; cards), a player normally needs two identical gangsters (same family, same value), to be able to take a gangster with the next higher value of the same family into his hand. When he does this, he places one of the smaller gangsters from his hand into his play area (the area near him on the table). To get the higher gangsters in a faster way, the player may use the special abilities of the different families, but at the cost of placing more gangsters in his play area. By doing so, however, a player may reduce his options and so must carefully plan these actions so that he can end the game with the most influential gang.

German edition by 2F - played just once. Shipping is: without shipping insurance: 2,50 EUR to Germany,6 EUR to Europe and 10 EUR worldwide with shipping insurance: 5 EUR to Germany,8 EUR to Europe and 13 EUR worldwide

Rio Grande Games (RIO 431) The players control two rival gangs and try to recruit additional gang members from the four families (La Famiglia, The Accountants, The Brutes, The Mercenaries) on the Street. The player, who uses the special abilities of the different families better than his opponent, will get the most influential gang and win the game.
The players collect gangsters, with the goal of collecting the higher-valued gangsters. With the exception of the smallest gangsters (the “0” cards), a player normally needs two identical gangsters (same family, same value), to be able to take a gangster with the next higher value of the same family into his hand. When he does this, he places one of the smaller gangsters from his hand into his play area (the area near him on the table). To get the higher gangsters in a faster way, the player may use the special abilities of the different families, but at the cost of placing more gangsters in his play area. By doing so, however, a player may reduce his options and so must carefully plan these actions so that he can end the game with the most influential gang.

Rio Grande Games (RIO 431)
The players control two rival gangs and try to recruit additional gang members from the four families (La Famiglia, The Accountants, The Brutes, The Mercenaries) on the Street. The player, who uses the special abilities of the different families better than his opponent, will get the most influential gang and win the game. The players collect gangsters, with the goal of collecting the higher-valued gangsters. With the exception of the smallest gangsters (the “0” cards), a player normally needs two identical gangsters (same family, same value), to be able to take a gangster with the next higher value of the same family into his hand. When he does this, he places one of the smaller gangsters from his hand into his play area (the area near him on the table). To get the higher gangsters in a faster way, the player may use the special abilities of the different families, but at the cost of placing more gangsters in his play area. By doing so, however, a player may reduce his options and so must carefully plan these actions so that he can end the game with the most influential gang.

Rio Grande Games (RIO431) The players control two rival gangs and try to recruit additional gang members from the four families (La Famiglia, The Accountants, The Brutes, and The Mercenaries) on the Street. The player who uses the special abilities of the different families better than his opponent will get the most influential gang and win the game. The players collect gangsters, with the goal of collecting the higher-valued gangsters. With the exception of the smallest gangsters (the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;0_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; cards), a player normally needs two identical gangsters (same family, same value), to be able to take a gangster with the next higher value of the same family into his hand. When he does this, he places one of the smaller gangsters from his hand into his play area (the area near him on the table). To get the higher gangsters in a faster way, the player may use the special abilities of the different families, but at the cost of placing more gangsters in his play area. By doing so, however, a player may reduce his options and so must carefully plan these actions so that he can end the game with the most influential gang.
